page.title: 18ST. ANDREW'S SCHOOL,N.K.
page.content: The old school, in Church St.was built in 1847. It consisted of a large and a small room.The toilets being in a small outbuilding.There was a school house for the Head teacher. The new school,in Dag lane,was first used in August 1969.It was formally opened in May 1970 by the Bishop of Leicester.It occupies a two acre site. There are three classrooms,a library,a hall and a kitchen,as well as cloakrooms and the usual offices. There are at present three teachers, sixty-six children,secretary,2 dining assistants and caretaker at the school .The headmaster since 1967 has been Mr.K.T.Timson B.A.,Dip.R.E.,A.C.P. The school has church services at the end of term,Ash Wednesday and St. Andrew's Day.The school has a Support Association,which raises money for equipment.
